alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Nash; Orange; Vance; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 8:25PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong shower with gusty winds to 40 or locally 50 mph will impact portions of southern Vance, southern Warren, northwestern Nash, southeastern Orange, southern Granville, northern Wake, Durham and Franklin Counties through 930 PM EST... At 823 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong shower producing gusty winds near Butner, or 9 miles west of Creedmoor, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill, Hillsborough, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Carrboro, Butner and Franklinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Dont wait until you see the first lightning flash before heading to safety. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity.

area.areaDesc: Durham; Franklin; Granville; Nash; Orange; Vance; Wake; Warren
